text: Santiago González Portillo (25 July 1818 - 1 August 1887) was a general from El Salvador. He served as President of El Salvador from 15 April 1871 to 1 February 1876http://www.worldstatesmen.org/El_Salvador.html, and as Vice President and commander-in-chief of the army during the term of his successor, Andrés del Valle. He served as the minister of war of El Salvador from 1863 to April 1871. He led a revolution in 1871 in which the conservative government was overthrown, and he amended the constitution. == References == Category:1818 births Category:1887 deaths Category:Presidents of El Salvador Category:Vice Presidents of El Salvador Category:People from Zacapa Department Category:National Liberal Party (El Salvador) politicians Category:Salvadoran military personnel Category:19th-century Salvadoran people
title: Santiago González (politician)
